title: Highest Newborn Tetanus Protection
description: In 2023, 100% of newborns in the Bahamas were protected against tetanus, showcasing the country's commitment to maternal and child health.

title: Leading Female Labor Force Participation
description: The Bahamas boasts a female labor force participation rate of 98.651% in 2023, one of the highest globally, indicating strong gender inclusivity in the workforce.

title: High Youth Employment Rate
description: In 2023, the employment to population ratio for ages 15-24 in the Bahamas was 79.588%, reflecting robust youth employment opportunities.

title: Advanced Education in Labor Force
description: With 98.774% of the working-age population having advanced education in 2023, the Bahamas ranks among the top countries for educational attainment in the labor force.

title: High Tariff Rates on Manufactured Products
description: In 2022, the Bahamas had a tariff rate of 33.23% on manufactured products, one of the highest globally, potentially impacting trade competitiveness.

title: Significant Tariff Rates on All Products
description: The Bahamas applied a tariff rate of 26.31% on all products in 2022, indicating a protectionist trade policy stance.

title: High Share of Tariff Lines with Specific Rates on Primary Products
description: In 2022, 25.97% of tariff lines on primary products in the Bahamas had specific rates, reflecting a complex tariff structure.

title: Lowest Fugitive Emissions in Energy Sector
description: In 2023, the Bahamas reported a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e in fugitive emissions from the energy sector, showcasing one of the lowest levels globally.

title: Minimal HIV Prevalence Among Children
description: As of 2022, only 100 children aged 0-14 were living with HIV in the Bahamas, reflecting one of the lowest prevalence rates worldwide.
